taskMan

Class TaskMan

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskMan.TaskMan

  • public class TaskMan
extends java.lang.Object
    The Main System that keeps track of the list of projects and the current Time. The TaskMan is also responsible of maintaining a resource manager (which in turn is responsible for managing the resources of the system).
    Author:
    Tim Van den Broecke, Joran Van de Woestijne, Vincent Van Gestel and Eli Vangrieken

    • Method Detail

      • unwrapProjectView

        private Project unwrapProjectView(ProjectView p)
        Unwraps the ProjectView object and returns the Project that it contained IF the unwrapped project belongs to this taskman: projectList.contains(project)
        Parameters:
        p - | the ProjectView to unwrap
        Returns:
        | the unwrapped Project if it belonged to this TaskMan | NULL otherwise

        Advances the current time to the given time.
        Parameters:
        time - The time to which the system should advance
        Returns:
        True if the advance time was successful. False if the time parameter is earlier than the current time.

      • createTask

        public boolean createTask(ProjectView project,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          int estimatedDuration,
                          int acceptableDeviation,
                          java.util.List<TaskView> prerequisiteTasks,
                          java.util.Map<ResourceView,java.lang.Integer> requiredResources,
                          TaskView alternativeFor)
        Creates a new Task without a set status.
        Parameters:
        project - | The project this task belongs to, this project must be notified whenever the state of this task changes
        description - | The description of the given Task.
        estimatedDuration - | The estimated duration of the Task.
        acceptableDeviation - | The acceptable deviation of the Task.
        alternativeFor - | The alternative Task.
        prerequisiteTasks - | The prerequisites Tasks for this Task.
        requiredResources - | The resource prototypes and their respective quantities that are required by for this task
        Returns:
        True if the creation of a new Task was successful. False if the projectID is a valid one. False if the creation was unsuccessful

      • createTask

        public boolean createTask(ProjectView projectView,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          int estimatedDuration,
                          int acceptableDeviation,
                          java.util.List<TaskView> prerequisiteTasks,
                          TaskView alternativeFor,
                          java.util.Map<ResourceView,java.lang.Integer> requiredResources,
                          java.lang.String taskStatus,
                          java.time.LocalDateTime startTime,
                          java.time.LocalDateTime endTime,
                          java.time.LocalDateTime plannedStartTime,
                          java.util.List<ResourceView> plannedDevelopers)
        Creates a Planned Task as issued by the input file.
        Parameters:
        projectView - | The project where this task belongs to
        description - | The description of the Task.
        estimatedDuration - | The estimated duration of the Task.
        acceptableDeviation - | The acceptable deviation of the Task.
        prerequisiteTasks - | The prerequisites of the Task.
        alternativeFor - | The alternative for the Task.
        requiredResources - | The resources (types) and their respective quantity required for this task
        taskStatus - | The status of the Task.
        startTime - | The startTime of the Task.
        endTime - | The endTime of the Task.
        plannedStartTime - | The due time of the planning of the Task.
        plannedDevelopers - | The planned developers of the Task.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the creation of the Raw Planned Task was successful.

      • setTaskFinished

        public boolean setTaskFinished(ProjectView project,
                               TaskView taskID,
                               java.time.LocalDateTime endTime)
        Sets the task with the given task id belonging to the project with the given project id to finished
        Parameters:
        project - the id of the given project
        taskID - the id of the given task
        endTime - the end time of the given task
        Returns:
        True if setting the task to finished was successful, False if it was unsuccessful false if the project ID isn't a valid one

      • setTaskFailed

        public boolean setTaskFailed(ProjectView project,
                             TaskView taskID,
                             java.time.LocalDateTime endTime)
        Sets the task with the given task id belonging to the project with the given project id to failed
        Parameters:
        project - the id of the given project
        taskID - the id of the given task
        endTime - the end time of the given task
        Returns:
        True if setting the task to failed was successful. False if it was unsuccessful. False if the project ID isn't a valid one. False if the end time is null or the end time comes after the current time.

      • setTaskExecuting

        public boolean setTaskExecuting(ProjectView project,
                                TaskView task,
                                java.time.LocalDateTime startTime)
        Set the task belonging to a specific project to executing.
        Parameters:
        project - | The project the task belongs to
        task - | The task that should be executing
        startTime - | The actual begin time of the task
        Returns:
        True if the task is now executing

        Parameters:
        resourceName - | the name of the new abstract resource
        availabilityStart - | the optional start time of the availability period
        availabilityEnd - | the optional end time of the availability period
        Returns:
        True when the prototype has been successfully initiated, false otherwise

        fromPrototype - | The prototype for which a new resource should be made
        Returns:

      • reserveResource

        public boolean reserveResource(ResourceView resource,
                               ProjectView project,
                               TaskView task,
                               java.time.LocalDateTime startTime,
                               java.time.LocalDateTime endTime)
        Reserve a resource for a task from a given start time to a given end time
        Parameters:
        resource - | The resource to reserve
        project - | The project the task belongs to
        task - | The reserving task
        startTime - | The start time of the new reservation
        endTime - | The end time of the new reservation
        Returns:
        True if the resource was reserved by the given task, false otherwise

      • getDeveloperList

        public java.util.List<ResourceView> getDeveloperList()
        This method will return an immutable list of every user managed by the resource manager that has the DEVELOPER credential
        Returns:
        a list of the developers in the system

      • planTask

        public boolean planTask(ProjectView project,
                        TaskView task,
                        java.time.LocalDateTime plannedStartTime,
                        java.util.List<ResourceView> concRes,
                        java.util.List<ResourceView> devs)
        Plan a task in the system from a given start time. Reservations will be made for all the required resources and the developers will be assigned.
        Parameters:
        project - | The project the task belongs to
        task - | The task to plan
        plannedStartTime - | The planned begin time
        concRes - | The resources to plan
        devs - | The developers to assign
        Returns:
        True if the task was planned and all reservations made

      • planRawTask

        public boolean planRawTask(ProjectView project,
                           TaskView task,
                           java.time.LocalDateTime plannedStartTime,
                           java.util.List<ResourceView> concRes,
                           java.util.List<ResourceView> devs)
        Plan a task in the system from a given start time. Reservations will be made for all the required resources and the developers will be assigned. It is however possible that this planning will conflict with other plannings in the system. It is the responsibility of the user when applying this method to check for conflicts using the findConflictingPlannings and handle these conflicts appropriately. If you want to be sure to not get into an inconsistent state, use planTask instead.
        Parameters:
        project - | The project the task belongs to
        task - | The task to plan
        plannedStartTime - | The planned begin time
        concRes - | The resources to plan
        devs - | The developers to assign
        Returns:
        True if the task was planned and all reservations made

      • getConcreteResourcesForPrototype

        public java.util.List<ResourceView> getConcreteResourcesForPrototype(ResourceView resourcePrototype)
        This method will locate the resource pool responsible for the given prototype and return an immutable list of all its concrete resource instances (wrapped in a resourceView object)
        Parameters:
        resourcePrototype - | The prototype for which the concrete resources are wanted
        Returns:
        an immutable list of resourceView linked with the concrete resources based on the given resource prototype, null if the prototype is not associated with any pool

      • getPrototypeOf

        public ResourceView getPrototypeOf(ResourceView resource)
        This method will find the prototype corresponding to the given resourceView and return a resourceView of that prototype. If there is no prototype associated with the given resource, this method will return null.
        Parameters:
        resource - | The resource to find the prototype of
        Returns:
        a resourceView of the prototype associated with the given resource or null if no corresponding prototype was found

      • getResourcePrototypes

        public java.util.List<ResourceView> getResourcePrototypes()
        This method will return a list of all prototypes present in the resource pools in this resource manager.
        Returns:
        an immutable list of resource prototypes. For every resource pool present in the system, one resource prototype will be added to this list

      • addRequirementsToResource

        public boolean addRequirementsToResource(java.util.List<ResourceView> resourcesToAdd,
                                         ResourceView prototype)
        Add resource requirements to a prototype
        Parameters:
        resourcesToAdd - | The new requirements to add
        prototype - | The prototype that the new requirements should be added to
        Returns:
        True if the new requirements were successfully added to the prototype

      • addConflictsToResource

        public boolean addConflictsToResource(java.util.List<ResourceView> resourcesToAdd,
                                      ResourceView prototype)
        Add resource conflicts to a prototype
        Parameters:
        resourcesToAdd - | The new conflicts to add
        prototype - | The prototype that the new conflicts should be added to
        Returns:
        True if the new conflicts were successfully added to the prototype

        Parameters:
        permission - | The permission to check
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        an immutable list of tasks that can be updated by a given user

      • getAllReservations

        public java.util.List<Reservation> getAllReservations()
        Return an immutable list of all the reservations present in the resource manager
        Returns:
        all reservations

      • findConflictingPlannings

        public java.util.HashMap<ProjectView,java.util.List<TaskView>> findConflictingPlannings(TaskView task)
        Finds all the conflicting plannings for the given task.
        Parameters:
        task - The task to check whether there are other tasks with conflicting plannings.
        Returns:
        A list of conflicting planned tasks.
